com.toolrental.managers

Class ToolRentalManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.toolrental.managers.ToolRentalManager

  • public class ToolRentalManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a class with the main public checkout(CheckoutRequest) manager method that will perform the actual business logic to either return a:
    - RentalAgreement if successful OR
    - a meaningful error message if unsuccessful

    The code first validates the CheckoutRequest and its implicit Tool and ToolCharge data with their respective three validators.
    Then it calls calculateCharges() and calculateChargeDays() with information from the request and lookup values.
    It currently is only called from ToolRentalService.checkout()..

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $Date: 2024/12/03 12:00:00
    Author:
    Michael Escott

    • Method Detail

      • checkout

        public RentalAgreement checkout(CheckoutRequest request)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Processes a rental checkout request and generates a rental agreement. Validates the request, retrieves tool and pricing information, and calculates rental charges based on the provided input.
        Parameters:
        request - the CheckoutRequest containing details about the tool rental.
        Returns:
        a RentalAgreement detailing the rental terms and calculated charges.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the request, tool, or pricing data is invalid.

      • calculateCharges

        public RentalCharges calculateCharges(CheckoutRequest request,
                                      ToolCharge pricing)
        Calculates the rental charges based on the checkout request and tool pricing. Includes calculations for total charges, discounts, and the final amount due.
        Parameters:
        request - the CheckoutRequest containing details about the rental.
        pricing - the ToolCharge object containing pricing rules for the tool.
        Returns:
        a RentalCharges object encapsulating detailed rental cost breakdowns.

      • calculateChargeDays

        public int calculateChargeDays(java.time.LocalDate checkoutDate,
                               java.time.LocalDate dueDate,
                               ToolCharge pricing)
        Computes the number of chargeable days for a tool rental within the specified date range. Takes into account weekdays, weekends, and holidays, based on the pricing configuration.
        Parameters:
        checkoutDate - the starting date of the rental period.
        dueDate - the ending date of the rental period.
        pricing - the ToolCharge object containing rules for chargeable days.
        Returns:
        the number of days the tool is chargeable based on the pricing configuration.
